notes: example - present, part of minimal set for tense
example - past, part of minimal set for tense

translations.translation: The two men will run away.

notes: example - future, part of minimal set for tense

sentences.transcription: murra nganyi garrkinga nhanhaguru/ guntu nhiaguru dhikarra

translations.translation: OK, I called that man so he will come back.

notes: another example of dhika occuring with an IMP (adding directional meaning?)

translations.translation: Take away this kangaroo, the dead one.

sentences.transcription: ga waltalha ngathu nhanhayi galguranha dhaldhrraanha

translations.translation: Yes, I take away this dead kangaroo.
Take away this big dead kangaroo.

notes: note that 'give me' does not have ba 'away' (contrast with 'give him', which does)

translations.translation: The two of you hit/will hit this man.

sentences.transcription: walya barninyi ngathu gatyiliwinga nhanhayi/ girniani

translations.translation: I can't break this one, it is strong.
He will break apart the strong (thing).
Give to the two of us.
You (might) give to the two of us.
(You might) give back to us all.

sentences.transcription: galkaiyinga nganyi yandraandru dhinaanha bulinga nganyi

translations.translation: I knocked my foot (because of?) on the stone and fell down.

sentences.transcription: galkaiyinga nganyi nhungurraguru dhinaanha bulinga nganyi

translations.translation: I knocked my foot (because of?) on it and fell down.
OK, the two of us were looking at each other yesterday.

notes: bhuli is likely to be a typo

translations.translation: Yes, OK, I will look at them.

sentences.transcription: gularra ini dhandra dhandra dhaldhrranha ini

translations.translation: Sit down and watch the kangaroos.

notes: note barninyi/-dhali 'unable' used here vs walya 'not' used elsewhere (eg. 'I can't hear it')

translations.translation: OK, far over there I see the kangaroo.

sentences.transcription: dhunabari ngali wirarra/ gurnrtu nhangkayi dhikalha ngaka/ murra ngalingu galkarra nhanha

translations.translation: Wait a while. The two of us will wait. Soon it comes to the water. The two of us will kill it. (We will wait until it comes back to the water. Then we will kill it.

notes: Does walya mean both 'can't' and 'don't'? Contrast with barninyi/-dhali 'unable'

sentences.transcription: barti yandru yanhdhagala/ walya ngathu ina ngaragala

translations.translation: You talk bad. I don't hear you.

sentences.transcription: ngathu nadyarra wikarla/ dhana birkirra marnianha

translations.translation: Tomorrow I will see (them) dance a ceremonial dance.
I want to go to the river.
That man there stole my meat.
I will ask him by and by.

sentences.transcription: gunkanga ngathu nhinha/ walya nganha nhulu galabanga

translations.translation: I asked him. He didn't answer me.
The sun is coming up now.
Soon the sun will come up.
Soon the moon will come up.
